name: Espresso
description: A full-flavored, concentrated form of coffee served in small, strong shots.

name: Cappuccino
description: Espresso with steamed milk and a layer of froth on top.
taste: Smooth, creamy with a mild espresso taste

name: Latte
description: A chocolate-flavored variant of a latte, often topped with whipped cream.
taste: Mild, creamy with a subtle espresso flavor

name: Americano
description: Espresso diluted with hot water to create a milder coffee.
taste: Smooth, slightly bitter with a watery texture

name: Mocha
description: A chocolate-flavored variant of a latte, often topped with whipped cream.
taste: Sweet, rich with a hint of chocolate

name: Macchiato
description: Espresso with a small amount of steamed milk, typically topped with foam.
taste: Bold with a hint of creaminess

name: Flat White
description: Similar to a latte but with a higher coffee-to-milk ratio and microfoam.
taste: Smooth, creamy with a strong coffee flavor

name: Cold Brew
description: Brewed with cold water over an extended period, creating a smooth, rich flavor.
taste: Smooth, less acidic with a natural sweetness

name: Iced Coffee
description: Chilled coffee served over ice, often sweetened and with added milk.
taste: Refreshing with a balanced coffee flavor
